sen.j: 天豊津媛命（あまとよつひめのみこと）は、欠史八代、懿徳天皇の皇后。
sen.e: Amatoyotsuhime no mikoto was the Empress of Emperor Itoku, one of the eight emperors living during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
sen.cmt: 欠史八代→定訳不明：Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns)としました。
sen.e: Amatoyotsuhime no mikoto was the Empress of Emperor Itoku, one of the eight emperors living during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).
Amatoyotsuhime no mikoto was the Empress of Emperor Itoku, one of the eight emperors living during the Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns).

sen.j: 孝昭天皇と武石彦奇友背の生母。
sen.e: She was the real mother of Emperor Kosho and Takeishihikokushitomose.
sen.cmt: 武石彦奇友背→Takeishihikokushitomoseと統一用語リストの表記に従いました。
sen.e: She was the real mother of Emperor Kosho and Takeishihikokushitomose.
She was the real mother of Emperor Kosho and Takeishihikokushitomose.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』本文での皇后で、息石耳命の娘。
sen.e: She was the Empress who appears in the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and the daughter of Ikisomimi no mikoto.
She was an empress in the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and a daughter of Ikisomimi no mikoto.
She was an empress in the main text of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and a daughter of Ikisomimi no mikoto.

sen.j: なお『古事記』での皇后は、師木県主の祖である賦登麻和訶比売（飯日比売）、『日本書紀』第1の一書では磯城県主葉江の男弟猪手の娘である泉媛、第2の一書では磯城県主太眞稚彦の娘である飯日媛 である。
sen.e: However, the Empress that appears in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) is Futomawakahime (飯日比売Iihihime), who was the ancestor of Shiki no agatanonushi, while in the 'alternate writing 1-1' transmitted by the Nihonshoki, the Empress is Izumihime, the daughter of Inode (猪手), who was the smaller brother of Shiki no agatanonushi Hae, and in the 'alternate writing 2-1,' the Empress is Iihihime, who was the daughter of Shiki no agatanushi Futomawakahiko.
sen.cmt: 師木県主→Shiki no agatanonushiとしました。 『日本書紀』第1の一書→定訳不明：the 'alternate writing 1-1' transmitted by the Nihonshoki としました。 猪手→正式な読み方不明です：Inode (猪手) としました。 男弟→定訳不明：smaller brotherとしました。 磯城県主葉江→Shiki no agatanonushi Hae としました。 第2の一書→定訳不明the 'alternate writing 2-1' としました。 磯城県主太眞稚彦→Shiki no agatanushi Futomawakahikoとしました。
sen.e: However, the Empress that appears in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) is Futomawakahime (飯日比売Iihihime), who was an ancestor of Shiki no agatanonushi, while in a first writing in the Nihonshoki, the Empress is Izumihime, a daughter of Inode (猪手), who was a younger brother of Shiki no agatanonushi Hae, and in a second writing, the Empress is Iihihime, who was a daughter of Shiki no agatanushi Futomawakahiko.
sen.cmt: 『日本書紀』第1の一書→a first writing in the Nihonshoki と訳出し（他も同様に訳出し）。冠詞の見直し。
sen.e: However, the Empress that appears in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) is Futomawakahime (飯日比売Iihihime), who was an ancestor of Shiki no agatanonushi, while the frist addendum to the Nihonshoki mentions the Empress is Izumihime, a daughter of Inode (猪手), who was a younger brother of Shiki no agatanonushi Hae, and the second addendum describes the Empress as Iihihime, who was a daughter of Shiki no agatanushi Futomawakahiko.
sen.cmt: a first writing in→the frist addendum toa second writing→the second addendum
